required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Revascularization Strategies for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction Trial: The ASSIST-MI Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Revascularization Strategies for ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Revascularization strategies for ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) study (The ASSIST-MI Trial) will compare the effects of two revascularization strategies [same sitting multivessel primary PCI (SS-PCI) and culprit vessel only primary PCI (IRA-PCI)] on myocardial infarct size (MIS) as determined by cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) imaging in patients presenting with STEMI and multivessel disease (MVD).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

arm_group.description: Same sitting multivessel PCI as an adjunct to primary PCI
IRA only PCI with planned staging for non-IRA lesions

intervention.description: IRA only PCI at the time of Primary PCI
Same sitting multivessel PCI as an adjunct to primary PCI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- High risk ST elevation myocardial infarction evidenced by: ≥2 mm ST elevation in 2 anterior or lateral leads; or ≥2 mm ST elevation in 2 inferior coupled with ST depression in 2 contiguous anterior leads for a total ST deviation of ≥8 mm; or New left bundle branch block with at least 1 mm concordant ST elevation.
- Multivessel CAD as evidenced by ≥1 significant (≥70% by visual assessment or FFR<0.80 for 50-70% stenosis) stenosis in non-IRA.
- Successful IRA-PCI with <10% residual angiographic stenosis and TIMI III flow.
- Written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age ≤ 18 years.
- Prior coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery.
- Administration of thrombolytic therapy.
- Non-IRA stenosis is a chronic total occlusion or located in left main artery.
- Hemodynamic instability evidenced by BP<90 mmHg, Killip class ≥2, need for inotropes/vasopressors.
- Known renal insufficiency (estimated GFR < 50ml/min).
- Contraindication to CMR.

clinical_study.keyword: Stent, Myocardial Infarction, Angioplasty, Coronary Intervention
